text: You did forensic photography?! That is a completely different path. Is that what got you interested in photography or did that come later when you started learning more about compositing?

Oooh. Living next to the sea sounds sounds beautiful, my dream is to have a holiday in the middle of mountains so i can be surrounded by nature, but i’m also scared of animals so hopefully I can find something similar.

I haven’t had any experience with actual compositing as i’ve only experimented with modelling and adobe software so this may sound quite naive. The truth is I became interested in VFX because I watched Blade Runner and Altered Carbon and really liked the tone that the movie had throughout because even though it’s distinctly cyberpunk, every scene in the movie/tv show belonged to a completely world that I’m living in yet still looked realistic as it was it’s own world. I didn’t use to like watching movies (although I’ve started watching a lot more from last year) so i never realised how good the visual effects are in movies. When I researched different roles I found that the compositor is the person who puts together the assets to make them look realistic and I want to be able to make final scenes.

I’ve also really enjoyed the photography assignment that I had to do as part of my university module which I’ve been told is beneficial in compositing. However, i won’t be sure until i start practising my compositing skills as right now i’m trying to learn as much as i can from photoshop and illustrator.
Also sorry i keep replying so late, the notification didn’t appear on the slack app so I figured you were busy preparing for the end of the year.
Also I was wondering if you would be ok with looking at some of my photography work and give me some advice on how i could improve. Only if possible though:)
